Update #1

 • Added a tabbed screen to display a list of what has been done, what is being done, and what is in the works for the future. There's also a list of known bugs as well as a tab dedicated to getting to know the programmer (aka, me).

 • What I have accomplished up to this point includes programming a fully functioning chess board on the chess board screen, a fully functioning and UI intensive tree to keep track of chess moves in an organized manner, as well as being able to save custom trees to then be loaded back up later. 

 • Importing games is also functioning, though there currently seem to be hitches in being able to import games with branching involved.

Name: Rowan McKee

 Occupation: Math Tutor and Independent Android Developer

 	I'm currently going to school for a mathematics and computer science double major, and my goal is to hopefully one day make a living off of making and developing games. I've been in love with chess my whole life (my parents taught me to play at age three), and I noticed there weren't very many programs out there that you could store and analyze chess moves in a tree like structure, so I decided to make my own, thus Chess Tree was born. I hope you all find it as useful as I do.
